summary: This is an automatic email notification from the CM/ECF system of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York regarding the filing of a motion to stay in the case USA v. Maxwell. The motion was filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim on April 1, 2022, and the notification lists the attorneys of record who were electronically served.

persons.name: Amanda Nicole Young
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial email forwarding the court notification, identified with the FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Filed the motion to stay on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell and is listed as the filer in the court notification.

events.title: Motion to Stay Filed
events.description: Defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim files a motion to stay in the criminal case USA v. Maxwell, referencing prior motions for a new trial and replies.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A motion to stay was filed on April 1, 2022, in the criminal case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell (Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN).
The motion was filed by defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document is an automatic court notification listing ten attorneys of record who were served electronically.
The notification was forwarded by an FBI employee in the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit.
